Package com.phasmidsoftware.dsaipg.util.benchmark

Class SortBenchmark

java.lang.Object
com.phasmidsoftware.dsaipg.util.benchmark.SortBenchmark
public class SortBenchmark extends Object

This class runs a suite of sorting benchmarks.

In order to make it work you need to do two things:
  1. Edit config.ini
  2. Provide command line arguments to specify the problem sizes that you want

Note that each benchmark smaller than 512,000 is designed to run in approximately 10 seconds. When the size equals or exceeds 512,000, that period of time will be roughly proportional to the size.

  • Field Details

    • BENCHMARKSTRINGSORTERS

    • TIME_LOGGER_RAW

      public static final TimeLogger TIME_LOGGER_RAW

    • timeLoggersLinearithmic

      public static final TimeLogger[] timeLoggersLinearithmic
      For mergesort, the number of array accesses is actually four times the number of comparisons (six when nocopy is false). That's because, in addition to each comparison, there will be approximately two copy operations. Thus, in the case where comparisons are based on primitives, the normalized time per run should approximate the time for one array access.

    • timeLoggersLinear

      public static final TimeLogger[] timeLoggersLinear
      Linear time loggers.

      public SortBenchmark(Config config)

      Parameters:

  • Method Details

    • main

      public static void main(String[] args) throws IOException
      The main method serves as the entry point for the SortBenchmark application. It loads the configuration for the benchmark, logs the starting details, and invokes the doMain method to execute the benchmarks.
      Parameters:
      args - The command-line arguments, representing word counts to be processed. If no word counts are provided, a warning is logged.
      Throws:
      IOException - If an IO error occurs during loading configuration or execution.

    • getLeipzigWords

      public static Collection<String> getLeipzigWords(String line)
      Extracts words from the given input line based on the Leipzig regex pattern: SortBenchmarkHelper.regexLeipzig.
      Parameters:
      line - the input string from which words are to be extracted.
      Returns:
      a collection of strings containing the extracted words.

    • runStringSortBenchmark

      public static void runStringSortBenchmark(String[] words, int nWords, int nRuns, SortWithHelper<String> sorter, TimeLogger[] timeLoggers)
      Method to run a sorting benchmark using the standard preProcess method of the sorter.
      Parameters:
      words - an array of available words (to be chosen randomly).
      nWords - the number of words to be sorted.
      nRuns - the number of runs of the sort to be performed.
      sorter - the sorter to use--NOTE that this sorter will be closed at the end of this method.
      timeLoggers - a set of timeLoggers to be used.

      NOTE: this method is public because it is referenced in a unit test of a different package
